message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) field, which is covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. The paper proposes a novel time-aware distant supervision framework for relation extraction in news data, which involves techniques such as time series analysis, instance-popularity encoding, and curriculum learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to NLP, such as text classification, information retrieval, and machine translation. 

The paper also involves some machine learning techniques, such as deep learning and neural networks, which are covered by sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Furthermore, the paper deals with multi-source news corpus, which involves information retrieval and data mining techniques, covered by sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper proposes a new framework for reducing noise in distant supervision labeling, which involves some statistical and probabilistic modeling techniques, covered by sub-category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
